stimulusHtml: Which of the following was one technique employed by Paleolithic artists at the Great Hall of the Bulls at Lascaux to create the clear lines of the animalsâ€™ forms?
choicesHtml: Using pens made from hollow animal bones filled with pigment to draw precise outlines
Using hands as stencils while blowing pigments to spray a surface
Using leather cut into shapes and soaked in pigment to print forms onto the wall
Using fingers dipped in fat from oil lamps to create wax contour lines
